snippet: Mitt Romney was the apparent winner in Ohio, but the closeness of race displayed the state’s deeply divided political passions.
abstract: Republican presidential contender Mitt Romney is the apparent winner over rival Rick Santorum in the Ohio primary, but closeness of the race displays the state’s deeply divided political passions; Ohio victory carries bragging rights suggesting the winner can also prevail in a general election in what has long been considered the ultimate swing state.

byline.contributor: Dalia Sussman contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney was the apparent winner in Ohio, but the closeness of race displayed the state’s deeply divided political passions.

headline.main: Ohio’s Divided Political Passions on Display in Vote
headline.print_headline: Romney and Santorum Fight It Out in Ohio With Much at Stake
